title: Computer Science Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Front Range Community College
Interview Descriptions:
-Schedules a meeting with the coordinator of the business and information systems department.
-Interviewed briefly about previous course work and grade within the computer science department with the coordinator before being offered a position.
Interview Questions: Q: Can you work a maximum of 20 hours per week?

title: HR Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Front Range Community College
Interview Descriptions: It was very friendly and there were 3 interviewers within the department. All were professional and asked their own questions. It was a good experience and they covered their basis overall. 3 interviewers were intimidating but it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: What kind of asset would you bring to the department?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Front Range Community College (Denver, CO) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: Timely and flexible, warm and friendly interview panel, phone screen, 1st interview, finalist interview, hiring decision made one month from last interview. HR and director very helpful and kind. Application required 5 page cover letter.
Interview Questions: Tell me about how you handled an unexpected situation

title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Front Range Community College
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is pretty simple, of course they ask what your tech experience is and why you'd like to work in the department. If you have interest in the IT department you will succeed in this interview so long as you show that interest.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Front Range Community College (Westminster, CO) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Meet with the Lead lab coordinator, toured the facility and took a brief safety video and eval. After completing the safety training and paperwork I was told that I would be notified within a few days if my work study would be approved. The lab coordinator was very concise and thorough in the interviewing process and I was very pleased to hear that I had the job within a few days!
Interview Questions: How well are you able to take directions and work independently?

title: Adjunct Instructor- English Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Front Range Community College
Interview Descriptions: I applied in early May 2016 and was invited for an interview in mid-July to teach one English Composition II class at the Westminster campus. I had an in-person interview with the department head where we discussed the position, expectations, training, etc. We also discussed my experience teaching, particularly my experience teaching this particular course and how my experience fit in to the goals of the college and the department. He was very honest and told me that five candidates were being interviewed and that he could not guarantee any classes for the spring semester. Overall, it was a pleasant interview and the department head was very friendly and easy-going in the interview.
Interview Questions: One of the goals of the department is info-literacy and technology use. How have you incorporated these goals in to your teaching methods?

title: Lab Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Front Range Community College (Fort Collins, CO) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: The application process was slow, but just when I gave up on the position an in person interview was scheduled.  The interview was scheduled for 30 mins. and seemed a bit rushed.  No time was granted for tour of lab.  The decision was made quickly (about a week), but I was not offered the job.
Interview Questions: What is your management style?

title: Teaching Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Front Range Community College (Fort Collins, CO) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Good and thorough. Thanks for all the help and info to make sure I can be better prepared for the real world.Good and thorough. Thanks for all the help and info to make sure I can be better prepared for the real world.
Interview Questions: What can you offer?

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Front Range Community College (Fort Collins, CO) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Two people, just read lines and wrote down fast.  They weren't very clear on exactly what they were looking for.  Seemed very dry, yet satisfied with direct, complete answers.
Interview Questions: What do you feel you can add to this company?

title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Front Range Community College (Westminster, CO)
Interview Descriptions: Interview with the Department Chair
Interview Questions: What if a student says they don't believe in evolution and do see why they have to learn about it.

title: Clinical Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Front Range Community College (Westminster, CO) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Friendly, low key. The interviewer discussed their goals, student types, and teaching plans. I was given a tour and was given email and phone numbers of people who can help with the process
Interview Questions: Do you enjoy the teaching/learning process?

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Front Range Community College (Longmont, CO) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Submitted app online.  Mailed in resume.  Didn't hear anything for 18 months.  One day, out of the blue, forgot I even applied, I got the call for an interview.
Interview Questions: Nothing.  I was pretty young, fresh out of college, they knew I had practically zero experience.  I think they were desperate.
